message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $11,500. It's a great deal, and I'm sure you'll find it very valuable.  Let me know what you think!
Hi Alice, thank you for your offer. I appreciate the value of your product, but I believe we can reach a more agreeable price. I would like to propose a counteroffer of $10,000 for the product.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, but $10,000 is just too low for me. I'm willing to come down a bit further, but I need to be closer to my asking price. How about $11,000?  That would be a fair compromise, don't you think?
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I would like to counter with an offer of $10,500 for the product.

Bob, I'm starting to feel like we're not going to be able to reach an agreement.  I'm willing to go down to $10,800, but that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me halfway, I'm going to have to move on to another buyer.
I understand your position, Alice. I would like to counter with an offer of $10,700 for the product.

Bob, I'm getting a little frustrated with this negotiation.  $10,700 just isn't enough for me to make this worth my while.  I'm willing to come down to $10,750, but that's my final offer.  If you're not willing to meet me there, I'm going to have to sell to John.
I appreciate your persistence, Alice. I would like to counter with an offer of $10,650 for the product.
